definition: include gels, however non-gel liquid polymers such as linear polyacrylamide, hydroxyalkylcellulose (HEC), agarose, and cellulose acetate, and the like can be used. Other separation media that can be used for capillary electrophoresis include, but are not limited to, water soluble polymers such as poly(N,N′-dimethylacrylamide)(PDMA), polyethylene glycol (PEG), poly(vinylpyrrolidone) (PVP), polyethylene oxide, polysaccharides and pluronic polyols; various poly(vinylalcohol) (PVAL)-related polymers, polyether-water mixture, lyotropic polymer liquid crystals, among others.
